title: If Ezreal's VGU goes well: Jax, Blitz and Kennen are next in line!

replies.body: I wouldn't say they are "next in line" It was just a few I could think of off the top of my head
I would add MF & Udyr to consideration personally, especially MF. People have been asking for her to get new voicelines for years & it'd be the perfect time to look at both her kit & model.
Udyr needs a full VGU at some point, and MFs art is much better then many other champions currently, so I wouldn't rank her as super high priority atm.

What about Veigar? He's pretty outdated, to the point that Final Boss is basically his VU. Smoother animations would do wonders for him.

I think Cho'Gath, LeBlanc and Fiddlesticks could also use a visual update.
Veigar is one we have talked about for a update like this as well
Would Volibear be on that list?
No, Volibear needs a full VGU

Hmm, can't really speed up the process much since they take the same amount of production time (Which is the the art/anim/vfx/sfx time.) They do take much less discovery/ideation time in the early stages when its just a designer, concept artists and narrative writer on it.

if that's so, it gonna be a long way to update all the champs then. BTW, do you mind telling us again the percentage of new champs/VGU's next year? Are there more VGU's next year and fewer new champs like this year, 50/50 or the opposite of this year, meaning, many new champs instead of VGUs. I hope that next year, it would be the same as this year because VGUs are more in demand than new champs as to new champs based on my research. And it will be a win-win situation too because players will still get to see new champs every year, much more promising and refreshing to the game and they will also see many older champs get updated.

PS: I think many players plays league again because of reworks than new champs these days.

Next year will likely be more of a 50/50 split like 2017. We have done surveys ourselves and found that it is about 50/50 from players in wanting VGUs or New Champs. VGUs are of course good because it brings older champions up to modern standards, but they also incur a cost, that not matter how good of a job we do some people will quit. We have to balance all of this when we decide what to prioritize.

We definitely care about Diana. We have actually tried doing a mini-rework on her internally twice, but both got scrapped because we couldn't find something that we thought would be good enough. We wan't to do something with her, but we want to make sure it's good. We could also wait a little longer and get through some higher priority VGUs and then do a Diana/Leona VGU like we are doing with K&M, where we do bigger kit stuff to Diana and a smaller mostly VU to Leona. That could be pretty cool as well. Time will tell.

Hey Reav3 can I ask about the considerations for VGUs who didn’t receive the full package, like Shen or Fiora who didn’t get new rigs or vos

I mean we would love to update these kinds of things one day, they are just much lower priority then many other things. Anything we do has to come at the cost of something else, and there are tons of Champions that are in much greater need of VGU's then that work atm. Any work we did on those would delay or push back current New Champions or VGUs in development, which just isn't worth the cost right now imo.

I have a feeling that riot is moving away from those partial updates (vu or gu only) and rather putting all the resources in full VGUs, even if maybe the gameplay part is less prominent (see aatrox, ezreal or Morgana)
And honestly, I'm all for it, the average success rate for full vgu seems to be a lot higher than that of partial reworks (be it gameplay-only or visuals-only) 

I'm looking forward to the ez update. Are you going to update PFE again, too?
I mean we are building Ez completely from the ground up (He has a whole new rig), so we have no choice but to update PFE as well :)

Question, will Ezreal still be an animesque pretty boy?

Or will he be more westernized?

Like I have mentioned before, we don't plan on changing his overall theme, just modernizing it a bit and polishing it up. Being a animesque pretty boy is kind of a core thing about Ezreal, so of course we want to preserve that.
What about Wukong? He was promised several seasons ago.

The thing about Wukong is that we used to only be able to get survey and data from players in Riot regions, and in NA/EU he is highly requested for a update. This made us put him high on our update list. A couple years ago though we started getting data from China as well. In China he is extremely popular and not anywhere close to highly requested for a update as most players there love his kit. This made us re-think his priority on our list as we have to think about all our players globally when we prioritize updates. While our NA/EU players would be happy with a Wukong update, it comes at a very high risk of just upsetting and confusing many players in China who wouldn't understand why we are updating a Champion like Wukong who they view as a great Champion.
Could you do a dev corner about how each region prioritizes a vgu?

Is there a reason for the difference? Besides Wukong being inspired from a Chinese myth, is there any reason why players in China like his *gameplay,* while players in other regions don't? I've heard the same about Yasuo from another Rioter.

I'm sorry but that feels this is the most unfair thing I've heard this year and is one of the reasons I'm unhappy with how Wukong is handled as a character in this game. Everyone else highly wants an update for him but because he's a Chinese champ first, he won't ever get one because they are satisfied with his gameplay. It feels terrible to main him and hear that he won't get an update he needs all because big brother china doesn't want him updated... 
 
It feels bias as hell and feels like it's just an excuse to push out other more popular champs before him. I can't speak for everyone  but We've been waiting YEARS for him to get updated and I'm NOT going to wait another 4 years for China to *possibly* be okay with an update for him.

I'm fine that Splash arts had to be updated to not include skull imagery due to China, but they can NOT be the reason he is being held up for an update, ESPECIALLY when champs HERE have been updated JUST as seemingly randomly like {{champion:114}}. Thinking about players GLOBALLY isn't "making sure China is okay with it first". It's a two way street for every country. You can't just sit there and change splash art to make it "globally friendly" then go back on that and say "China specifically does not want him changed, so we decided leave him as is".

He has the potential to be a great character no matter what country, but the fact that China is holding the leash forces him to always be the Chinese champ. Honestly if that's how it's going to be then why bother releasing him globally in the first place? He's not EVER going to be used in LCS, his merch and skins are tailored to Chinese audiences and now even his GAMEPLAY is decided by china? so why bother giving us Wukong if everything about him is dictated by Chinese players? Are any other champs following this rule of "because X country says so"? Is Morde left alone cause Brazil says they don't want him updated?

He will eventually get an update,he is just less of a priority because of it.

I mean it is only natural that they'll focus on champs whose VGUs get requested globally first and there are likely also cases where the chinese want a champ to be updated even though said champ is considered fine in other regions.

Yea, but how LONG will that be? We've already been waiting 4 years for China to give the green light apparently and it sounds like they are far from dissatisfied with his kit enough to be wanting an update. The fact is there will ALWAYS be a higher priority champ at this rate who will be moved up ahead of him. To me less priority says "he won't be updated ever unless by some miracle we can get every champ updated and perfectly balanced".
And the thing is most of us aren't even asking for a VGU. As far as that goes I can agree that there are those who are far more in need ({{champion:80}} {{champion:82}}, hell even {{champion:24}}). But from the sounds of things he's not even going to be getting the gameplay update that he needs and was all but promised by Riot at this point, all because of Chinese players said no.
I am a Chinese Wukong player and I don't know where the fuck Riot Games took the survey. Most Chinese Wukong players are keen to see the rework too. Please don't get us wrong.

if you care about chinese wu players that much then why did you nerf him so hard ? would not that upset them ? i bet it would for sure but please buff his damage sustain and passive bcs im pretty sure everyone knows they are so weak and bad

Hello! I am a Chinese main Wukong player for two years. I have in general 65% win rate with him on top lane that I believe I have a very solid understanding about this champion. 

I am not entirely sure the source of your data or feedback collected from China region, but in most Chinese Wukong main's opinion, Wukong seriously needs a rework because he has the most out-dated skill kit and almost pointless passive. The top Wukong player in China region - Yixin, who has been using Wukong to reach Challenger every season since S4 also agrees Wukong needs a rework. The complains you may have heard about him bursting ADCs is only due to he is well fed, otherwise he is SO WEAK in both top lane and jungle that he can easily go 0-7 without any chance of getting up. The Riot Balance Team nerfed his armor penetration on patch 4.5 and then never paid any significant attention to him afterwards for FOUR YEARS. Now just because well fed Wukong players started to use {{item:3147}} {{item:3095}} combination, your balance team totally destroyed him that he is virtually UNPLAYABLE. To be honest with you, I am abusing Nexus Blitz not because it's fun but I do not want to look bad in the Rift.  

You may or may not read my comments because you might not even bother. League of Legends is such a big game that you do not really care if you would lose a big group of people who loves Wukong. However, if you claim what I am saying is not true, then please hear my voice and re-consider your decision about not reworking Wukong. 

Sun Wukong is a Chinese legend, the Buddha of Combat, not some piece of crap that can be bullied by almost anyone. 

Thank you very much for your attention!!!!
